greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Period 2: repeat [0, 2].
comment: Euler number (or Euler characteristic) of (n+1)-sphere. - _Franz Vrabec_, Sep 07 2007
First differences of A109613. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 05 2009

a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n-1} (-1)^k*N_k, for n >= 1, is Schläfli's generalization of Euler's formula for simply-connected n-dimensional polytopes. N_0 is the number of vertices, ..., N_{d-1} is the number of (d-1)-dimensional faces. See Coxeter's book for references, also for Poincaré's proof. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Feb 09 2018
reference: R. Carter, G. Segal, I. Macdonald, Lectures on Lie Groups and Lie Algebras, London Mathematical Society Student Texts 32, Cambridge University Press, 1995; see p. 68.
H. S. M. Coxeter, Regular Polytopes, third ed., Dover publications, New York, 1973, p. 165.
link: Muniru A Asiru, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000

mathematica: PadRight[{},120,{0,2}] (* or *) LinearRecurrence[{0,1},{0,2},120] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, May 29 2016 *)
program: (Maxima) makelist(if evenp(n) then 0 else 2, n, 0, 30); /* _Martin Ettl_, Nov 11 2012 */
